title: What channel is Arsenal vs Bournemouth? TV information and live stream details
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest Arsenal FC stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Arsenal will look to continue their brilliant home form this weekend as they welcome Bournemouth to the Emirates Stadium.

Unai Emery’s side easily saw off Belgian side Standard Liege in the Europa League on Thursday Evening as they consolidated their space at the top of Group F.

Bournemouth have had a fine start to the season, picking up eleven points from their opening seven games and lie joint-sixth in the table.

They come into the game on the back of an entertaining 2-2 draw at home to West Ham and have lost just twice in the league this season.

An unlikely away win would see the Cherries leapfrog their opponents and, depending on other results, potentially move into the top four.

Here’s all you need to know ahead of the game.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

When is the match?

The game takes place on Sunday October 6 at 2pm (GMT).

Where is the match taking place?

The match is taking place at the Emirates. In the corresponding fixture last season, the Gunners picked up a comfortable 5-1 win.

What TV channel is the match on?

The match will not be broadcast in the UK but you can follow all the action via the Mirror Football’s live blog.

(Image: ANDY RAIN/EPA-EFE/REX)

Can you stream the match live?

Unfortunately, Sunday afternoon’s match will not be broadcast live and is unable to be streamed.

Betting Odds from ThePools.com

Arsenal 1/2

Draw 4/1

Bournemouth 5/1
description: Arsenal welcome Eddie Howe's Cherries to the Emirates on Sunday
